intro: Silene bogdanii, commonly known as the bog sandpink, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands and bogs of northern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in acidic, waterlogged soils and is often found in sphagnum moss-dominated habitats. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Silene bogdanii is a rare and protected species, often threatened by habitat loss and environmental changes.
